projects.title: DisaVu
projects.description: Solution that uses machine learning to improve disaster response after hurricanes/tornadoes
achievements: First place in the AWS Disaster Response Hackathon.
An application that uses machine learning vision models to localise zones of damage to quickly figure out where support is needed post disaster.

The first model segments building foorprints from satellite imagery using a modified UNET architecture using over 150K images from the SpaceNet2 Challenge dataset and creates segmented before and after images.
The second model takes these building footprints and classifies the level of damage using a fine tuned RESNET model fine-tuned on a subset of the XView2 DataSets.
Solution was presented at the AWS RE:MARS 2022 event by AWS.

projects.title: (Work) Safety Dashboard
projects.description: A published case study on work to improve operator safety in light vehicles and surface mining equipment
achievements: Proven, quantified reduction in reportable vehicle events.
Modular, scalable design to support multiple combinations of systems across multiple mine sites.

projects.title: CORTX Spark Integration
projects.description: Hadoop and Spark integration using the Seagate CORTX S3 compatible API
achievements: Second place in the Seagate CORTX Integration Challenge.
Replaced Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS), a common distributed data storage layer in the Hadoop ecosystem with Seagates CORTX object storage Protocol.
Demonstrated operability of this storage layer through Apache Spark - A common distributed big data analytics tool.
Created an ansible script to automate the setup of the integration for a standalone single node cluster to ensure reproducibility.

projects.title: Sensing the air quality in my room
projects.description: Used an Azure Sphere Internet Of Things (IOT) device along with Azure IOT services to create a dashboard of Carbon Dioxide and particle levels in my room
achievements: Runner up in the Azure Sensing the World competition.
Wrote C code targeting the Azure Sphere IOT device (including libraries for the MHZ-19 and PMS7003 sensors).
Used Azure IOT for transport of device to cloud messages.
Implemented Azure Direct Methods on the Azure Sphere to modify the devices mutable state via cloud to device messages.

projects.title: Lock and Load
projects.description: Cloud enabled Remote Frequency Identification (RFID) lock using the Azure Sphere Internet of Things (IOT) device
achievements: One of several runner-up awards in the Secure Everything with Azure Sphere Challenge.
Used Azure Sphere hardware to build an IOT enabled lock that was capable of working with and without a network connection.
Allowed over the air addition of new RFID cards.
Hosted an application on Azure Web Apps with Azure Active Directory (Entra) authentication and Authorization to perform device administrative actions via cloud to device communications.

projects.title: WACTF 2018 - Second Place
projects.description: WACTF is a weekend long challenge based cybersecurity competition (Capture the Flag) created and hosted by the Perth cybersecurity community.
achievements: Placed second amongst 60 teams competing that weekend.
Challenges included reverse engineering, offence and defencive web security, application exploitation and cryptography challenges.

projects.title: NASA Spaceapps - Supergiant Scuti
achievements: One of four finalists for the Best Use of Hardware Award.
Used Unity to build an AR/VR data visualisation solutions to be used in classrooms.

projects.title: Monte Rocks
projects.description: Created a physics based monte carlo simulator to minimise rock bridges
achievements: Built a physics based simulator of rocks tipping from a dump truck to calculate the impact of rock fragmentation on blockages in a primary crusher chute.
The simulator generated rocks along a rock fragmentation probability distribution function which is generated by a set of blasting inputs.
These rocks would then be tipped into a modelled primary crusher chute and using discrete element analysis over a small set of time jumps, modelled the final resting places of the rocks.
By running this simulation hundreds of times, we were able to generate a monte carlo probability of a rock bridge being generated and the size of that rock bridge for each set of blasting parameters
These probabilities were then used to generate a cost model showing an optimal cost point for a finer fragmentation (higher explosive costs) with the associated cost benefit of reduced rock bridges.

projects.title: Unleashing SAG2
achievements: Built a digital twin of a grinding circuit.
Used a genetic algorithm to provide recommendations to operators for settings that may optimise the grinder for a given set of inputs.

projects.title: KLOG - IOT Safety Device
projects.description: Mesh networked IOT safety device using the B.A.T.M.A.N mesh networking protocol.
achievements: First place in the BHP/Unearthed Digital Tribes Hackathon.
Built an IOT device to improve safety in mine sites with limited telemetry by using mesh networking over 2.4GHz WiFi.
